Description: This Paths of the trail is the most southern; here you go through dessert
Description_new: The southernmost trail section crosses desert terrain. Stay hydrated - days are hot; nights cold. You'll pass Sheephead Mountain; Wooden Hill; and traverse Sawtooth Mountains wilderness with its characteristic peaks.

Description: You are in the very southern part and in summer this can be very hot You will pass through rugged desert terrain featuring occasional oases and challenging climbs in this segment
Description_new: The southern section is hot in summer. You'll traverse Anza-Borrego Desert State Park (est. 1932; 237;120 ha) with amazing spring flowers. The park's name combines explorer Juan Bautista de Anza and "borrego" (sheep). You'll pass Warner Springs and skirt Combs Peak; where recent fires have made hiking easier through the chaparral vegetation of manzanita; scrub oak; buckthorn; red shanks and chamise.

Description: You will walk through Jacinto Wildernes   You need to cross Mission Creek several times
Description_new: Traverse Jacinto Wilderness near Suicide Rock; which offers mountain views without major climbing. The Deer Springs Trail ascends through oaks to pines; reaching a massive granite slab with panoramic vistas. Free permits required. Views include Sand to Snow National Monument with iconic red mountains backed by snow-capped peaks. The trail also climbs Onyx Peak in the San Bernardino Mountains.

Description: On this part of the Trail yo can see Mt Baden Powell who is the founder of scouts. The first groups of scouts were formed in 1907 on the basis og his book Aids for Scouting
Description_new: See Big Bear Lake; the jewel of San Bernardino National Forest; known for fishing; snowboarding; skiing; hiking and mountain biking. The forest covers 3;333.87 km_ in two portions. This area served as filming location for Daniel Boone (1936) and parts of Paint Your Wagon (1969).

Description: You walk on the egde of Big Bear City You go in Angeles National forests
Description_new: Cross Interstate 15 and climb 1436m over a long stretch. Pass Table Mountain and Mount San Antonio. Nearby Vasquez Rock features striking jagged formations created by erosion. The trail enters Angeles National Forest; providing solitude and recreation opportunities for surrounding communities. Climb Mount Baden-Powell; named for scouts founder whose first groups formed in 1907.

Description: On this part of the route you walk in a mixture of hilly terrain and valleys of sand You are both  on the egde of moutains and have some of the trail in the city of Lancaster
Description_new: Walk through hilly terrain and sandy valleys. Pass through Agua Dulce (59 km_); a rural community with rolling hills near Vasquez Rocks. The trail crosses Lancaster and meets Walker's Pass; a Sierra Nevada mountain pass with panoramic views. Burnt Peak (1781m) offers expansive vistas; and Lake Hughes provides tranquil waters for recreation.

Location: Sierra Nevada & Northern California - Kennedy Meadows
Description: This part of the trail is hilly and you will need to cross several small creeks
Description_new: Traverse hilly terrain with multiple creek crossings. Pass Double Mountain with its two similarly elevated summits south of Tehachapi. Near Mojave; a desert city established in 1876 as a Southern Pacific Railroad construction camp. From 1884-1889; it served as western terminus for the 266km twenty-mule team from Death Valley's Harmony Borax Works; later becoming headquarters for Los Angeles Aqueduct construction.

Location: Sierra Nevada & Northern California - Sequoia National Park
Description: You will both walk in hilly terran and forretes  You walk in both Owen Peak Wilderness; Kiavah Wildernes and Domeland Wildernes. A part with a lot of protected nature; so in this path the chance for uniqe experince
Description_new: Hike through Owen Peak; Kiavah; and Domeland Wilderness areas. Ascend Weldon Peak for expansive views; then wind between Piute Peak and Sorrell Peak. Skirt Pinyon Mountain with its pine forests before reaching jagged Sawtooth Peak. These protected wilderness areas showcase diverse landscapes from rugged mountains to intricate rock formations and pristine forests; offering unique experiences in untouched nature.

Location: Sierra Nevada & Northern California - Kings Canyon National Park
Description: You will be climbing many meters both up and down. You will be walking through the South Sierra Wilderness and there will be several mountain peaks and peaks around you along the way  You are walking in an area with many mountains. Some of the ones you can see on the trip are: Mount Withney; Mount Langley; Kern Peak; Cirque Peak
Description_new: Experience the South Sierra Wilderness surrounded by dramatic peaks including Rockhouse; Ball Mountain; Bald Mountain; and Olancha Peak. The remote landscape offers profound nature connections. The trail carves through breathtaking Sierra Nevada terrain with towering sentinels like Mount Stanford; Mount Williamson; and iconic Mount Whitney; before descending toward Mount Langley and Cirque Peak; culminating near Muah Mountain.

Location: Sierra Nevada & Northern California - Sonora Pass
Description: You are in the middel of Inyo National Forrest. Inyo National Forest extends approximately 265 kilometers near the California and Nevada border. It covers about 809.371 hectares mostly on the eastern slope of the Sierra Nevada
Description_new: Traverse Inyo National Forest; which spans 265 kilometers along the California-Nevada border covering 809;371 hectares; mostly on the Sierra Nevada's eastern slope. Pass between Mount Clarence King; Acrodectes Peak; Mount Goddard; and Mount Darwin - a flat-topped 4;218-meter peak in the Sierra Nevada between Fresno and Inyo counties in Kings Canyon National Park.

Location: Sierra Nevada & Northern California - Lake Tahoe
Description: You are walking in an area with many mountains and you encounter many altitude differences at the same time there are many larger and smaller lakes  You walk in both Ansel Adams Wildernes and the great Yosemite National Park. It was first protected in 1864.Yosemite National Park is best known for its waterfalls but you can find deep valleys and grand meadows as well
Description_new: Navigate Sierra Nevada's dramatic altitude changes around peaks like Bloody Mountain; Red Slate Mountain; Bear Creek Spire; and Seven Gables. Encounter lakes near Silver Peak and Mammoth Lakes. Traverse Ansel Adams Wilderness and Yosemite National Park with Mount Ritter; Mount Lyell; Mount Dana; and Clouds Rest; experiencing waterfalls; valleys; meadows and ancient sequoias; connecting with American wilderness history.

Location: Sierra Nevada & Northern California - Feather River
Description: As the trail moves northward; it traverses the lush forests of Northern California; with a mix of steep inclines and dense woodland  During this par of the trail You'll cross the border between California and Oregon
Description_new: Experience Yosemite and Hoover Wilderness with lush forests; steep inclines and rugged paths. Wind through dense woodlands with clearings offering views of Tower Peak. This challenging backcountry journey rewards with solitude and wildlife encounters. Continue through Carson-Iceberg Wilderness with Highland Peak; Whitecliff Peak; Sonora Peak; and Leavitt Peak; featuring rocky landscapes; glacial remnants; dense conifer forests and various waterways.

Description: It is a varied terrain with both forest and desert  and you will pass by a lot of large and small lakes
Description_new: The Lake Tahoe trail offers majestic landscapes through the Lake Tahoe Basin Management Unit. Ascend Ralston Peak and Pyramid Peak for sweeping views of the lake and dense forests. The area is renowned for stunning natural beauty with towering peaks and lush valleys; attracting both seasoned hikers and scenic enthusiasts; with unique recreational opportunities.

Description: You will walk in Donner Memorial State Park some of the parth. The very large Lake Tahoe is close by  the closest towns to the trail are Tahoe Pines; Homewood and Rubicon Bay  You walk on the egde opf Sierra city. You need to cross North Yuba River and Haypress Creek. When Crossing North Yba Falls You walk very close to Love Falls
Description_new: Near Lake Tahoe; the trail weaves through rugged terrain with forest and mountain views. Notable peaks include Granite Chief and Tinker Knob. Nearby towns Truckee and Tahoe City offer amenities; historical charm and services. Cross North Yuba River and Haypress Creek; passing close to scenic North Yuba Falls and Love Falls - popular for picturesque views and cascading water sounds.

Description: This is a hilly stretch where you also have to cross the Middle Fork Feather River  If You do the hole trail you are in this segment in the middel or half to reach your desination. You need to cross North Fork Feather River and Yellow Creek
Description_new: Traverse Plumas National Forest through dense forests; mountainous vistas and remote wilderness. Enjoy solitude and rich biodiversity among various tree species; wildflowers and wildlife. Pass near Quincy for resupply. This segment marks the trail's halfway point; winding through Bucks Lake Wilderness past Bald Eagle Mountain; Ben Lomond; Snow Mountain; Castle Rocks and Eagle Rocks; crossing Highway 70 multiple times.

Description: You will here walk in Lassen Volcanic National Park. You walk between different Mountans and Peaks. This is a parth with various elevation
Description_new: Navigate diverse volcanic landscapes with Lassen Peak; one of the world's largest plug dome volcanoes; as backdrop. The trail skirts Brokeoff Mountain and Mount Harkness; enhancing the trek with educational opportunities. Wind through mixed forests; mountain streams and meadows with diverse ecosystems and wildlife; combining volcanic landmarks and natural beauty with physical challenges.

Description: You will cross Pit River and come close to Burney Falls; which is 25 meter and defenitly a visit worth. Here You can find campsites and Rental Cabins  You'll walk in Shasta-Trinity National Forrest and Lassen National Forrest. If the water level is high You need to cross several small creeks and streams
Description_new: Experience varied landscapes of rolling hills; dense forests and meadows while crossing Pit River with its stunning views. The river area contrasts with surrounding dry terrain; creating unique wildlife habitat. Pass near Burney Mountain and the town of Burney for resupply. Traverse rugged mountainous terrain with Grizzly Peak; Brushy Butte and Tamarack Mountain; offering panoramic views through forests and clearings.

Location: Oregon - Bridge of the Gods (Columbia River Gorge)
Description: You'll walk through Castle Crags Wilderness and Castle Crags State Park. You will cross Burstarse Creek; Indidan Creek and Popcorn Spring during the trail  You will be able to see several peaks on this parth including: Russian Peak; Deadman Peak; Eagle Peak; Sugar Hill; Craggy Peak; Cory Peak and Mount Eddy
Description_new: Trek through Castle Crags Wilderness and State Park; crossing Burstarse Creek; Indian Creek and Popcorn Spring. The trail crosses the Sacramento River near Dunsmuir. View peaks including Russian Peak; Deadman Peak; Eagle Peak; Sugar Hill; Craggy Peak; Cory Peak and Mount Eddy. Traverse Shasta-Trinity National Forest (California's largest) through diverse ecosystems including dense alpine forests and wildflower meadows.

Description: You will walk in Klamath National forres and Marble Mountain Wilderness. You climpe Big Ridge with the elevation of 2141meters
Description_new: Journey through Klamath National Forest and Marble Mountain Wilderness with expansive; rugged terrains; vast wilderness and dramatic landscapes. Climb Big Ridge at 2;141 meters elevation.

Description: On this stretch you will pass through Seaid Wally and up over Kangaroo Mountain; Black Mountain and Observation Peak among others. A stretch with many meters of elevation gain  During this par of the trail You'll cross the border between California and Oregon
Description_new: Navigate through Seiad Valley and over Kangaroo Mountain; Black Mountain and Observation Peak with significant elevation gains. The remote trail winds between mountains through diverse landscapes from dense forests to rocky outcrops. Seiad Valley along the Klamath River offers resupply. Continue through Carson-Iceberg Wilderness past Highland Peak; Whitecliff Peak; Sonora Peak and Leavitt Peak; experiencing rugged terrain and stark Sierra eastern slopes.

Description: You will walk in The Sky Lakes Wilderness straddles southern Oregon's Cascade Range from Crater Lake National Park southward to Oregon Route 140. It is approximately 9.7 kmwide and 43 km long. Thelevations ranging from 1.200 m in the canyon of the Middle Fork of the Rogue River to 2.894 m at the top of Mount McLoughlin is the highest peak in southern Oregon  You will walk close by Crater Lake that is surrounded by several high points. This including Garfield Peak; Llao Rock and Grouse Hill
Description_new: Cross Sky Lakes Wilderness in Oregon's Cascade Range (9.7km wide; 43km long) with elevations from 1;200m at Middle Fork Rogue River to 2;894m at Mount McLoughlin. Visit Crater Lake National Park (est. 1902); surrounded by Garfield Peak; Llao Rock and Grouse Hill. The 7;700-year-old lake formed after a violent eruption collapsed a tall peak; creating America's deepest and most pristine lake.

Description: On this part You walk in hilly terrain and pass Cowhorn Mountain which is  2336 meters high
Description_new: Experience serene hiking with expansive views; lush forests and Diamond Peak's rugged slopes. Pass 2;336-meter Cowhorn Mountain through hilly terrain. The trail skirts several lakes; providing water sources and scenic camping spots.

Description: In this Segment You will walk through Willamette National Forrest and Deschutes National Forrest and pass several lakes  On this part of the trail You walk past tree vulcanos that is caled The Tree Sisters. When You have Middel Sister and South sister on one side You will have the moutan The husband on the other side of you
Description_new: Traverse Oregon's volcanic landscape passing the iconic Three Sisters volcanoes with close-up views of North; Middle and South Sister on one side and The Husband peak on the other. The trail crosses Three Sisters Wilderness with diverse ecosystems including alpine forests; lava fields and wildflower meadows. Continue through Mount Jefferson and Mount Washington Wilderness areas with the distinctive spire-topped Mount Washington.

Description: On this part of the trial You will wlak in the National Park of Mount Hood  Mount Hood is also known as Wy'east. It is an active stratovolcano. The summit elavation is 3.429 meter and has glaciers all year
Description_new: Wind through Oregon's landscape with notable buttes and Clackamas Wilderness. Pass Olallie Butte overlooking numerous lakes and dense forests with views of Mount Jefferson. Approach Mount Hood (Wy'east); an active 3;429-meter stratovolcano with year-round glaciers - Oregon's highest peak; visible from Portland. The surrounding Mount Hood Wilderness (est. 1964) offers alpine meadows; mountain streams and old-growth forests.

Location: Northern Washington & Canada Border - Pasayten Wilderness
Description: On this part You'll cross the Columbia River and also the border between Oregon and Washinton. On both sides You walk in forrest. This could be a good place to stock up as you come right through the town of Casade Locks which is the biggest city You will go through
Description_new: Cross Columbia River and the Oregon-Washington border. Walk through forests on both sides. Cascade Locks; the largest city on the trail; provides an excellent resupply point.

Location: Northern Washington & Canada Border - Holman Pass
Description: Now You are walkning in Gifford Pinoct National Forrest. It contains over 1.3 milion acers of green forests soaring mountains; dewy meadows; and rapid streams  On this part You walk through the Mount Adams Wildersness; where the trail take you close to the mountan and the glacier
Description_new: Traverse Indian Heaven Wilderness with old-growth forests; alpine lakes and wildflower meadows. Pass Sawtooth Mountain; Bird Mountain and Lemel Rock with their vibrant autumn colors. Enter Mount Adams Wilderness near the mountain and glacier; then through Goat Rocks Wilderness near 2;494-meter Gilbert Peak - the highest summit in the eroded remnants of an extinct stratovolcano with Meade and Conrad Glaciers.

Location: Northern Washington & Canada Border - Castle Pass
Description: Mount Rainier is the most glaciated peak in the contiguous U.S.A.; spawning five major rivers. You will see subalpine wildflower meadows ring the icy volcano while ancient forest cloaks Mount Rainiers lower slopes You are walking in Norse Peak Wildernes
Description_new: Journey near Mount Rainier; the most glaciated peak in the contiguous US. Traverse William O. Douglas and Norse Peak Wilderness with subalpine wildflower meadows and ancient forests. Pass Norse Peak; Crown Point; Pigtail Peak and Kelly Butte Lookout (1;640m) with its panoramic views. Cross Snoqualmie Pass (919m); an important Cascade Range mountain pass 50 miles east of Seattle carrying Interstate 90.

Location: Northern Washington & Canada Border - Manning Park (Canada)
Description: You go thrugh Snoqualmie is best known as the home of Snoqualmie Falls- a breathtaking waterfall cascading 81.6 meter over granite cliffs. Snoqualmie Falls is the second most visited natural landmark in Washington after Mount Rainier. It is more than twice as high as Niagara Falls!
Description_new: Cross Alpine Lakes Wilderness with rugged terrain; deep valleys; craggy peaks and numerous lakes. Features include challenging climbs and scenic Chimney Rock. Enter Henry M. Jackson Wilderness (41;803 ha); created by 1984 Washington Wilderness Act and named after the senator instrumental in designating many state wilderness areas. The terrain features steep slopes and finger ridges with streams draining into Sauk and Skykomish Rivers.

Description: You are walking in Alpine Lake Wildernes  You are walking in the north and meeting several glaciers including Kennedy Peak and Glacier Peak
Description_new: View 2;260-meter Mount David in Chelan County within Okanogan-Wenatchee National Forest. Encounter Kennedy Peak and 3;213-meter Glacier Peak - Washington's fourth highest with White Chuck; Kennedy and Suiattle glaciers. The surrounding Glacier Peak Wilderness (229;075 ha; est. 1964) protects the upper drainage basin of Sauk; Suiattle and White Chuck Rivers with steep terrain; old-growth forests and alpine lakes offering challenging backcountry opportunities.

Location: Northern Washington & Canada Border - Fraser Valley
Description: In theese segments the trail cover some of the most challenging and rewarding terrain of the PCT; culminating in the alpine glory of the North Cascades  This is the most northly part of the trail
Description_new: Experience challenging terrain with high alpine peaks and remote wilderness. The trail passes near Bonanza Peak; Mount Fernow; and Lake Chelan National Recreation Area with significant elevation changes near Goode Mountain and Black Peak. View 2;393-meter Mount Winthrop in Okanogan County. The Northern Terminus at the US-Canada border near Manning Park; British Columbia marks the end/beginning of the 4;690-kilometer journey.
